attributes.comment:
I am writing to voice my opposition to the proposal to raise fees impacting
international adoption by an average of 66%. Adoption in general, but especially
international adoption, is already an expensive, stressful, and unpredictable under-
taking. I'm sure other adoptive parents have told you of the months or years of
waiting, the tens of thousands of dollars in expense, and the lifetimes of
commitment to children -- many of whom have medical and emotional conditions
related to their sub-standard care in overseas orphanages. These parents make
great sacrifices to adopt internationally and should be honored, not punished with
higher fees from USCIS. It is impractical and illogical for the US government to
raise rates from one department and then offer a tax credit for adoption-related
expenses on the other. Our adoption will cost us $10,000 beyond the credit, so
there is still a need to maintain or reduce USCIS fees, not increase them.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Angela J. Manuszak
